intro: Thelasis triptera, commonly known as the three-lobed thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant features spiny, lobed leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Thelasis triptera is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical structure supports its role in local ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
